subject: Education
title: Anxiety and Test Performance
description: A quick, practical guide to Anxiety and Test Performance.

hook.text: She knew every answer in practice but blanked the moment the real exam started.

buildup.text: Test anxiety hijacks working memory, filling it with worry instead of problem-solving.

discovery.text: Beilock showed that anxious students lose the most on complex questions requiring reasoning.

twist.text: Ten minutes of expressive writing before a test reduced the anxiety gap dramatically.

climax.text: Externalizing worries frees working memory to focus on the actual problems.

punchline.text: Sometimes the fix is a pen, not more studying.

quiz.question: How does test anxiety impair performance?
options: It consumes working memory with worry, leaving less for reasoning
It makes students read questions too quickly
It only affects students who didn't study
